intro: Manettia sonderiana, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink or red. It typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves. Manettia sonderiana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories.
